See all publications (30) Biography Maxime Lamothe is an assistant professor at Polytechnique Montreal and is currently looking for master’s and Ph.D. students. Maxime studied software build systems as a postdoctoral researcher in the Software REBELs Lab at the University of Waterloo. His doctoral thesis, conducted in the SENSE Lab at Concordia University, focused on reducing knowledge gaps between the users and developers of software APIs. He obtained his Ph.D. from Concordia University (2020), M. Eng. degree from Concordia University (2017), and B. Eng. from McGill University (2013).
